entry.title: Bitcoin Mining Moratorium Passes Vote in New York State Assembly
entry.summary: The New York State Assembly passed a two-year moratorium on crypto mining activity on Tuesday evening. Now, the bill is headed to the state’s Senate.

entry.title: Elon Musk’s Twitter Buy ‘A Great Win for Free Speech’: Coinbase CEO
entry.summary: Coinbase CEO Brian Armstrong praised Musk's acquisition of Twitter, citing a “very dangerous” trend towards censorship on the social media platform.

entry.title: 'We Don't Consider Ourselves an Ethereum Competitor': Ava Labs President
entry.summary: Despite nearly $2 trillion in total market cap, the crypto industry is still too small to compare major projects, according to Ava Labs president John Wu.

entry.title: Buenos Aires Mayor Touts Plan That Permits Tax Payments in Bitcoin
entry.summary: Allowing residents to pay taxes with cryptocurrencies is but one part of Mayor Horacio Rodriguez Larreta's vision for improving government.

entry.title: GOP Congressman Cawthorn Accused of 'Let's Go Brandon' Crypto Pump-and-Dump
entry.summary: Rep. Madison Cawthorn was already drowning in scandal—now he faces a new one related to possible crypto insider trading.

entry.title: Bitcoin Is Struggling to Take Off in El Salvador: Report
entry.summary: The National Bureau of Economic Research concludes that not many people in El Salvador are using Bitcoin, despite a law that compels businesses to accept it.

entry.title: Robinhood to Lay Off 9% of Employees as Growth Slows
entry.summary: Robinhood CEO Vlad Tenev announced that several hundred people are being let go. But the trading firm is still hiring for numerous crypto roles.

entry.title: CleanSpark Borrows Against Bitcoin Mining Rigs to Get $35M for More Mining Rigs
entry.summary: The Las Vegas-based company and other Bitcoin miners like RIOT Blockchain, HIVE, and Bitfarms have had a rough start to 2022.

entry.title: What Is Optimism? Using Rollups to Help Scale Ethereum
entry.summary: Optimism helps Ethereum users save on gas fees by rolling up batches of transactions, using a technology known as optimistic rollups.

entry.title: Ethereum Scaling Project Optimism Launches DAO, Plans to Airdrop OP Token
entry.summary: The Optimism Collective will be tasked with not only governing the protocol but also funding public goods.

entry.title: Avalanche's New Wallet Will Feel 'Smooth as Silk': Ava Labs President John Wu
entry.summary: John Wu, a key figure behind Avalanche, shared his thoughts on the future of easier-to-use crypto wallets, venture capital, and subnets.

entry.title: Dogecoin Dumping Gains From Elon Musk’s Twitter Buy, Down 9%
entry.summary: The volatile meme coin is struggling to hold onto its Monday gains, steadily slipping following the latest Musk bump.

entry.title: 0x Labs Raises $70M in Series B Round Led by Greylock
entry.summary: Others participating in the round included Coinbase, Pantera Capital, and OpenSea.

entry.title: gm Podcast, Episode 8: All About Avalanche with John Wu
entry.summary: Ava Labs president John Wu talks to Dan Roberts and Jeff Roberts about the meteoric rise of so-called "Ethereum killer" Avalanche (he hates that phrase), its utility and usability, AVAX token, tribalism in crypto, the SEC and regulation, and NFT backlash.

entry.title: MicroStrategy to Offer Employees Bitcoin Retirement Plans
entry.summary: The firm will be the first company to give employees the chance to add Bitcoin to 401(k) savings accounts.

entry.title: Fort Worth Passes Vote for City Government to Mine Bitcoin
entry.summary: Three ASIC Antminer S9 rigs, donated by the Texas Blockchain Council, will run on a private network at Fort Worth City Hall.

entry.title: Ethereum DeFi Project Teller Facilitates First Uncollateralized Mortgage Loan
entry.summary: On-chain DeFi mortgages are here.

entry.title: GamerGains Gets $5.8 Million for Solana Play-and-Earn Platform Supporting Web2 Games
entry.summary: Cadenza Ventures led the round, joined by FTX, Winklevoss Capital, BlockFi, Tiger Global, Alumni Ventures, Lightbank, and others.

entry.title: Intuit Sued Over Phishing Attack Targeting Trezor Crypto Wallet Users
entry.summary: The class-action lawsuit alleges Intuit “willfully, recklessly, or negligently” failed to protect Mailchimp data and, ultimately, Trezor users.

entry.title: Crypto Is No Way to ‘Opt Out of Inflation': Bank of Canada
entry.summary: Canada’s central bank doesn’t see cryptocurrencies like Bitcoin replacing the Canadian dollar any time soon.

entry.title: Fidelity to Let Workers Save 20% of Retirement in Bitcoin
entry.summary: Financial services giant Fidelity Investments will allow investors to diversify their 401(k) savings accounts with Bitcoin.

entry.title: Bitcoin Rebounds Above $40,000 After Bearish Weekend
entry.summary: Amid a wave of bullish news, leading cryptocurrencies Bitcoin and Ethereum have regained several points since the weekend’s drop.

entry.title: Decentralized Twitter Project Bluesky Says It's Unaffected by Elon Musk Purchase
entry.summary: Bluesky is a Twitter-backed project to "develop an open and decentralized standard for social media." But it's independent of the company.

entry.title: SEC Adds 'Misleading' Crypto Firms to Public Alert List
entry.summary: "SuperBinance," "BTC Investments," "Bitpayfxpro," and other companies have been the subject of consumer complaints, according to the SEC.

entry.title: NFL Releases 2022 Draft 'Virtual Ticket' NFTs on Flow
entry.summary: Official NFT Draft collectibles are now available for each team ahead of this week’s event.

entry.title: PROOF Raises $10M From Reddit’s Ohanian After Moonbirds NFT Launch
entry.summary: Kevin Rose’s Web3 media company gets an infusion of funding, while PROOF’s COO departs following controversy.

entry.title: Alleged 'Shadow Banker' Reggie Fowler Pleads Guilty to Fraud in Crypto Capital Case
entry.summary: The long-running case is coming to a close.

entry.title: Dogecoin Soars 26% After Twitter Accepts $44 Billion Bid From Elon Musk
entry.summary: “Twitter has tremendous potential—I look forward to working with the company and the community of users to unlock it,” Musk said.

entry.title: Twitter Accepts Elon Musk's $44 Billion Takeover Bid
entry.summary: Tesla and SpaceX CEO Elon Musk is about to take over another company: Twitter.

entry.title: Bored Ape Yacht Club Instagram Hacked, $2.8M in Ethereum NFTs Stolen
entry.summary: The NFT project’s official Instagram account was compromised, and users who fell for the scam had their NFTs stolen.

entry.title: What is Ethereum (ETH)? A Beginner's Guide to the Smart Contract Blockchain
entry.summary: Created by Vitalik Buterin, Ethereum is a cryptocurrency that allows smart contracts and decentralized applications (dapps) to operate on its network.

entry.title: OpenSea Acquires Ethereum NFT Aggregator Gem in Push for 'Pro' Users
entry.summary: Gem lets users batch-buy NFTs from multiple platforms to save on fees, and OpenSea plans to integrate its functionality.

entry.title: Fort Worth Could Start Mining Bitcoin in ‘Crypto-Friendly’ Bid
entry.summary: If passed, tomorrow’s city council vote would see the city of Fort Worth begin mining Bitcoin as part of a six-month pilot program.

entry.title: Dogecoin Surges on Reports Twitter Will Reconsider Elon Musk Buyout Offer
entry.summary: New reports suggest Elon Musk will acquire Twitter for $43 billion in cash. Following these reports, Dogecoin has since rallied.

entry.title: Shiba Inu Launches ‘Burning Portal’ to Reward SHIB Token Holders
entry.summary: A new burn portal now lets Shiba Inu token holders is incentivizing participants to cut the meme coin’s circulating supply.

entry.title: Zilliqa, NEAR Protocol Suffer Double-Digit Losses as Crypto Market Dips
entry.summary: As the broader cryptocurrency market bleeds red, several Layer-1 coins, like Zilliqa and Near, are facing significant losses.

entry.title: Grayscale Renews Push With SEC for Bitcoin Spot ETF
entry.summary: The Securities and Exchange Commission has so far approved only BTC futures ETFs.

entry.title: This Week on Crypto Twitter: SEC Proposal Ruffles More Feathers, Bored Apes Back in Spotlight
entry.summary: Plus: NFT project Akutars got off to a calamitous start when $34 million was permanently locked into a faulty smart contract.

entry.title: Aku Ethereum NFT Launch Ends With $34M Locked in Flawed Smart Contract
entry.summary: Mistakes in the code for the prominent project launch mean that $34M worth of ETH is apparently inaccessible.

entry.title: Animoca Brands ‘Not Done Acquiring’ Studios to Make NFT Games: Chairman
entry.summary: The metaverse investor and NFT game publisher recently picked up three game developers—with potentially more to come.

entry.title: The Beijing Olympics Was the Coming Out Party for China’s Digital Yuan. What Comes Next?
entry.summary: China first considered a CBDC in 2014, ramping up research in 2019. Now it's live and in wide use, and could lead other countries to follow.

entry.title: NFT Artist pplpleasr: 'You Should Be Thinking of DAOs Like Subreddits'
entry.summary: Emily Yang, aka pplpleasr, the inspiration for the NFT collective PleasrDAO, talked DAOs and crypto interest groups on Decrypt's gm podcast with Dan Roberts and Jeff Roberts. Yang says people shouldn't be joining DAOs with the aim of making money; she compares them to Subreddits or video game clans.

entry.title: Astronaut Scott Kelly Discusses NFT Project, Crypto Holdings, and the Metaverse
entry.summary: Retired NASA astronaut Scott Kelly talks to Decrypt’s Andrew Hayward about his new Ethereum NFT collection, which benefits relief efforts in Ukraine, plus the cryptocurrencies he holds and his excitement about the metaverse.

entry.title: Gemini COO Talks to Decrypt at Bitcoin Miami 2022
entry.summary: Gemini COO Noah Perlman talks to Decrypt's Kate Irwin at Bitcoin Miami 2022 about Gemini's approach to competing with other exchanges, its focus on regulatory compliance, and his own views on Bitcoin maximalists.

entry.title: Robinhood Crypto CTO Talks to Decrypt at Bitcoin Miami 2022
entry.summary: Robinhood Crypto CTO Johann Kerbrat talks to Decrypt's Kate Irwin at Bitcoin Miami 2022 about Robinhood's new Lightning Network integration, potential NFT plans, and Kerbrat's personal history with crypto, including mining Bitcoin back in 2010.

entry.title: gm Podcast, Episode 7: pplpleasr and the NFT Art Revolution
entry.summary: Emily Yang aka pplpleasr never thought she'd be an online celebrity. But in 2021 an NFT version of a digital ad she did for Uniswap sold for $525,000 to a DAO of her fans, and now she's among the most famous NFT artists. She speaks to Dan Roberts and Jeff Roberts about the rise of NFT art, the traditional art world taking it seriously, NFT haters, and which NFT marketplaces can beat OpenSea.

entry.title: Ice Cube: Crypto and NFTs Are ‘The Ultimate Fuck You to the Mainstream’
entry.summary: The legendary rapper, actor, and entrepreneur Ice Cube talks to Decrypt's Andrew Hayward about why his BIG3 basketball league plans to offer fractional team ownership in the form of NFTs, plus his personal interest in crypto.

entry.title: #DecryptLIVE: Crypto, Taxes, and You
entry.summary: Tax Day is coming, and the crypto world is paying attention. Decrypt's Jeff Roberts, Stacy Elliott, and Adriana Hamacher discuss what people and businesses need to know about crypto and taxes with special guest Nicholas Mowbray of Baker Hostetler.

entry.title: gm Podcast, Episode 6: Ditching Big Banks for Bitcoin With Caitlin Long
entry.summary: Caitlin Long spent nearly two decades at big banks Credit Suisse and Morgan Stanley before she went all in on Bitcoin. Now her company Custodia is seeking to offer banking services to crypto companies long shut out by the big banks. She talks to Dan Roberts and Jeff Roberts about identifying as a Bitcoin maximalist, crypto regulation in DC, and Web3 culture.

entry.title: Crypto on the Campaign Trail: Matt West, Matthew Diemer, Tyler Lindholm at Camp Ethereal 2022
entry.summary: Politicians are embracing crypto on both sides of the aisle. Matt West, running for congress in Oregon, Matthew Diemer, running for congress in Ohio, and former Wyoming Rep. Tyler Lindholm discussed crypto and politics on a panel with Decrypt's Jeff Roberts at Camp Ethereal in Wyoming. As Diemer pointed out, "We have a conservative Republican, a progressive Democrat, and a moderate Democrat on the same stage, unified by crypto and the idea of making sensible regulation."
